alert.note: Alert for Dougherty (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 09 at 9:22AM EDT until April 12 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Tallahassee FL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River at Albany affecting Dougherty County. For the Flint River...including Albany...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Flint River at Albany. * WHEN...From Sunday evening to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 15.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow evening to a crest of 26.7 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 26.7 feet on 03/27/1942. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight.
